choices.B: They facilitate the planning, building, running and monitoring of an entity's IT
choices.C: They allow an entity to manage its complex interactions
choices.D: A link between COBIT 5 to other standards and framework is provided
choices.A: A link between Governance and Management is provided

questions.question_text: Why are the enabler dimensions important?

discussion.content:
Agree. From ISACA materials:
All enablers have a set of common dimensions. This set of common dimensions (figure 13):
• Provides a common, simple and structured way to deal with enablers
• Allows an entity to manage its complex interactions
• Facilitates successful outcomes of the enablers

Agree. From ISACA materials:
Each capability level can be achieved only when the level below has been fully achieved. For example, a process capability
level 3 (established process) requires the process definition and process deployment attributes to be largely achieved, on
top of full achievement of the attributes for a process capability level 2 (managed process).

questions.question_text: When can a process be rated as a capability level two?

choices.B: The process must be rated F - Fully for all process attributes at level two, and be rated L -Largely on level one
choices.C: The process must be rated L - Largely or F - Fully achieved at level two, and be rated F-Fully achieved on level one
choices.A: When all process attributes are F- Fully for level two
choices.D: When the process attributes of the five capability levels, rate an average score of two

questions.question_text: Why is COBIT 5 considered to be an integrated framework?

discussion.content:
Agree. From ISACA materials:
 Principle 3: Applying a Single, Integrated Framework—There are many IT-related standards and good practices, each
providing guidance on a subset of IT activities. COBIT 5 aligns with other relevant standards and frameworks at a high
level, and thus can serve as the overarching framework for governance and management of enterprise IT.

choices.B: It integrates in any governance system
choices.C: It integrates IT-related goals with enablers
choices.D: It aligns with other relevant standards
choices.A: It integrates enterprise goals with IT-related goals

questions.question_text: Which statement describes the difference between specific and generic work products?

discussion.content:
Based on this ISACA publication, I think it's C
https://www.isaca.org/resources/isaca-journal/issues/2016/volume-1/how-cobit-5-improves-the-work-process-capability-of-auditors-assurance-professionals-and-assessors

Selected Answer: C
I think it is C. page 42 figure 19
No reference found from study material. Any help welcomed

choices.A: Specific work products are defined at each capability level, generic work products are defined on an organizational level
choices.C: Specific work products are defined for each process, generic work products are defined for all generic processes from capability level 2 to 5
choices.B: Specific work products are associated with the IT-related goals, generic work products are associated with the higher level enterprise goals
choices.D: Specific work products define the objectives at activity level, generic work products define the level objectives of a process

questions.question_text: Which item describes a key component of a Governance System used to implement the Governance Objectives?

choices.D: Optimization of IT assets, resources and capabilities

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think it is B
